ratings.comment: This was the worst class I've taken. AVOID IT AT ALL COSTS. This professor was terrible. If you need to take calculus do it with someone else.

Deng is passionate about what he teaches, but bc of this he tends to teach things fast bc they make sense to him. He does stay to answer questions after class so that's nice. He's more understanding to the whole class vs. individual. The grading scale was a slap in the face at first tho - but he did adjust it after multiple students complained.

He's a very knowledgeable teacher, don't get me wrong. However, his grading criteria was off the wall, you could never really tell what he wanted from you at the end of the semester. Course work does not run synonymous with the tests. Don't take him. Simple.

He's nice and knowledgable but that's where the pros end. The midterms are bad, buggy, honorlocked, strictly scheduled, and way harder than the material you learn. Lectures online are unhelpful and unclear; useless. Somehow the curve brought grades DOWN. Communication and standards weren't clear until FAR after the drop deadline. Do not take this.

The class is very dependent on how well you do on your weekly "mid-terms" and final exam. Homeworks were very easy, but the profs teaching was very difficult to follow. He seemed like a very kind person, but his lectures were not the best. I usually did the worksheets and practice problems rather than actually watching the lectures.

His lectures were unhelpful and very hard to follow. I eventually got so frustrated I stopped watching them and taught myself the material. He promised a curve all semester on the final grades and ended up hurting students by curving grades down to the point anything below an 80 was a D.

Terrible. Take someone else. Super nice guy, but a terrible teacher. Doesnt give you a grading scale but promises a curve, only to curve the class so it only benefits the top 25%. If you get bellow a 80% it will be a D letter grade. I can not stress this enough, do not take a class with Deng.

worst math class I've taken, only top 25% are allowed to get A's, said theyd curve it at the end but the curve only helped the top 25%(despite test average being a D), if you can take anyone else do so and if you must take quanling wait till another semester and take someone else, poor at explaining, tests are overly difficult, awful professor

He is considerate and made several attempts to help his students because of covid. BUT, he is not a good teacher. His lectures were almost impossible to follow and very disorganized. He doesn't reply to emails either. I unfortunately also got an unhelpful TA, so my only way to learn was to read the textbook directly, which was less than ideal.

Deng is the worst professor I have had so far. He is extremely difficult to understand. He overcomplicated this course. His lectures weren't helpful and he promised a curve all semester just to not give one out at the end. Would not recommend.

Bruh. Worst class i've ever had! Coming from precalc in HS it was so stressful having to teach myself everything because I couldn't follow his lectures. He teaches like we already know the material and its review. Pray you get a helpful TA, because I learned most things from them. He makes the material more complicated than it needs to be.

the man wont tell you anything you need to know. if you want to learn, better read the textbook. if you want to know your grade, better take a different professor. wont even give you an answer if you email and ask

Deng is one of the kindest & most understanding professors I've had. Despite his lectures being a little messy/hard to understand, it's clear that he's very intelligent & cares about his students' success. The textbook + hw are really helpful, and if you do the worksheets, you'll do well on the tests. I'm sure he'll improve even more in the future.

Deng is possibly the best math instructor. He is so caring, fair, and kind. He is a great person to talk to during office hours. There was a big technical issue mess up with the final midterm due to proctoring software and he decided to give everyone full marks cause it wasn't fair for any of us. No one can beat him I'm telling you!
Extremely considerate for all his students and puts their interests first.

He's a really nice guy, super understanding too  he's made a few changes to the syllabus after seeing how poorly we were doing in the beginning of the year to try and boost our grades which was sweet. BUT, he's not good at teaching which makes each week so difficult, pretty much teaching myself everything. Hoping he'll improve in the future.
Truly cares about his students.

I'm so glad I chose Deng. He realized it was a hard semester for us since we're all online, so he made it easier in terms of exams and homework. He cares about the students. His lectures are confusing but his kindness beats it. I've had office hours with him getting help and just talking about life in general. Funny guy :)

Hes too scatter brained. I could barely show up to lectures anymore because they arent even helpful. He doesnt ever cover the full topic. He just barely starts it, then moves on to the next. The TA was helpful, but I learned everything from the homeworks. Also there is a test once a week. Dont take this class if hes teaching.

This was Deng's first year as a professor and I thought he did a very good job. I felt his lectures were usually a good pace and he was always open to take questions at the end of each lecture. He was very flexible, one test the average was like 40% and he agreed it was unfair and replaced that score with our average scores of all our other tests.

Hes been super flexible with the pandemic and always gave the benefit of the doubt on tests and assignments. If there was ever a mistake he instantly fixed and always willing to answer questions if students reach out. The people who didnt reach out for help, didnt do as well just as it is in most college classes during the pandemic (:
Mandatory tests weekly. Very scattered lectures and hard to follow. Would not recommend

Its Dengs first year and I think a lot of people have been hard on him. Hes a really smart guy who definitely knows whats hes talking about, but sometimes he doesnt get the point across very well. Weekly quizzes that arent too difficult if you watch some YouTube videos. Curves at the end of the semester. Nice dude and he will improve.
Dude is a sick guy. Cares about his students a lot and is improving on teaching every day. He cares about his students getting a good grade. Trust in quanling

Professor Deng is very intelligent, but it works against him as a professor for lower level courses. He has a hard time explaining the basics and bringing it down to your level. Better off teaching yourself from the textbook than going to lecture. DO NOT TAKE HIS COURSE ONLINE! He is not understanding about technical difficulties in my experience.

He's beyond skilled in his field and you can tell he tries. Teaching is just not his thing imo. The lectures were so confusing that I eventually stopped attending them; I only learn from youtube and the textbook now. His handwriting is also difficult to read. No idea as to what your grade will be since it's all curved at the very end. Nice guy tho
